result.execSummary:
The defendant Hans E Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court grants 4 days credit if revoked.

Court will consider early termination of probation at any point after 12 months, if all conditions are met and Agent deems appropriate.
Consecutive to: to Counts in case 21CF1313

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain full time employment.  Attend Anger Management course.  

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Cash bail on deposit to be applied to Cost/Surcharge.  Remaining balance to be refunded to poster.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hans E Schroeder

records.addlTxt:
Letter from the Department of Corrections requesting a review of the judgment of conviction.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/18/2022 - Although the DOC correctly recites the law, the interpretation of the sentence in wrong. The probationary terms were not ordered consecutively. The Court merely stated that if revoked, the sentences on the various counts would be consecutive. No further action needed.**
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case was set for motion hearing and jury status, but the parties have reached a resolution.
State files an Amended Information into both cases.
Defense acknowledges receipt of Amended Information and waives reading.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

Court conducts plea colloquy.

In case 21CF1313: 
Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Amended Counts 1 & 2,  Court finds defendant guilty.

In case 22CF483:
Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Amended Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.

Parties request a separate sentencing date.
The Jury Trial is removed from the calendar.

Hearing on April 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:16 PM Defendant Hans E Schroeder in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant is asking for additional time to retain Attorney Nicholas Martinez.  The State has no objection to an adjournment.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel/status of prelim before the Trial Court to tag along with the defendant's other matter.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on March 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

02:15 PM Defendant Hans E Schroeder in court, in custody.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant states he plans to retain attorney Nicholas Martinez for this matter as well.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court sets status of counsel date next week.  Hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
